I believe they don't "wash". They merely wipe the cars with a pail of recycled plain water.
Which will leave them with a lots of water marks eventually  and damage the paints isn’t

Oh have is have  I mean like no workers to wash peopl car
Ah...I see....if no existing competition at your area  I guess u can try rather then regret not trying later. 😁
The only Heinz I know sells beans (beans means Heinz)
They got ketchup also. I add that to my rice towards month ends.
Now petrol station charge $11 per wash. I suppose not many car owners willing to pay this amount for a wash. If you can do at a cheaper rate  then you might have a chance.
I already see $12 at some sir
I would assume it's not just the price
If@woshijordanjrcan offer a better quality wash with good equipment and do it within the confines of the carpark
I wouldn't be surprised if people would prefer it
As they don't have to drive to the petrol kiosk  don't have to worry about cloths used  don't even have to leave the house if they trust him to move the car within the carpark
The pricing depends on how much his equipment costs him and what his cost of consumables per wash is
And how much he values his time at
But there is always a market when a more convenient and quality offering is available

I will only be free like at night sometimes and weekends
